title: SriLankan Airlines asked delay aircraft lease plan by COPE
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT  – State-run SriLankan Airlines has been asked to delay a plan to lease new aircraft by parliament’s committee on public enterprises, a legislator said following a meeting at the parliament with airline’s board.
SriLankan requested proposals to lease 20 airbus aircraft and 20 alternative models, with leases of existing aircraft running out.
“As a start all timelines would be extended by 3 months,” de Silva said.
He said there was no Treasury representative and officials were not fully aware of the gravity of the situation.

Today we summoned the @flysrilankan Board to #SriLanka @ParliamentLK committee. They admitted they did not know the #SriLankaEconomicCrisis was this grave when the decision was made and agreed to suspend the entire process. As a start all timelines would be extended by 3 months. https://t.co/rmGIMDdRfu
SriLankan Airlines officials have said the process may take 6 to 12 months. (COLOMBO/26Apr/2022)
